It's actually... quite good. I picked up the game thinking it was going to be another one of those poorly executed games based on a popular series but upon diving deep into the gameplay mechanics, story, and various other game modes I realized quickly that a great amount of time and effort was put into the game. One thing to note is that like many other gacha RPGs the gear is also random with randomized stats. Obviously most gear ends up being totally worthless with a terrible trade-in value.

This game has grown so much. However, there are problems. For example, even if the settings are extremely high, the characters do not move their mouths when dungeons are cleared. Facial expressions are at a minimum even with the extremely high settings.

Many anime adaptations fail to capture the source material's essence, but the *Solo Leveling* game development team has achieved a remarkably faithful and polished product. In summary, the game is exceptional, certain aspects necessitate improvement.

If you like Solo Leveling, and want a F2P game, this game is awesome for 60-90 days. This game is hard as F2P. Watch the YouTube guides. Player stats must be built a certain way, not the way it's shown in the manga, to advance the story. Gold is not easy to get, draw tickets need strategy, and artifacts need to be carefully upgraded. Watch YouTube guides. After around 60 days, you're going to hit a point where you have to pay, or it just gets impossible. I stopped at 100 days.

Overall, while Solo Leveling excels in graphics, controls, and immersive storytelling, it faces notable issues in its upgrade mechanics and game flow, which may affect long-term player satisfaction. Having played Genshin Impact for the past two years,Genshin Impact offers a more generous loot and drop rate system for character upgrades, making progression smoother for free-to-play (F2P) players. In contrast, upgrading skills beyond level 7 in Solo Leveling is challenging for F2P players .

Update: The developers seem to listen to the community and implicated several QOL improvements. The game plays a bit smoother now with fewer crashes. However the biggest issue is the lack of resources you can get. Gold, summon stones (essences) materials to upgrade your shadows and more are kind of scarce. Even doing high end content like A and S gates net you next to nothing in compared to the amount of effort it takes. I'm not asking for handouts, but make it worth the time we spend in game.

Bad - Heavy Monetization in every party of the game system, 3 Tiered Battle Pass, Boring events such as leveling/skill upgrading/weapon upgrading, Loading is everywhere not just transitions. The game is fun, in reference to the combat. However, in typical Netmarble fashion, this game is not f2p friendly. Gold is used for everything, and you don't get enough to make any meaningful progression every day. The gear system is the most important part of progression, and with 5 stats, all dependant on RNG, you need luck on luck to get anything useful. Do you know how demotivating it is to use all your dungeon keys every day and get literally nothing useable? All resources are a trickle.

Good game, follows anime and manhwa fairly accurately. Game play is fun, challenging, and requires skill whether you are free to play or pay to win. Graphics and performance are excellent, but severely based on your device and its capabilities. The biggest issues are the loading times, lack of a real exp or gold farming, and level caps to progress the story/content. There are many games out there that are far worse and missed the mark, based off anime, manga or comics, this isn't one of them.
